subject: Personal Finance
title: The Moving-to-Avoid-Taxes Myth
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Moving-to-Avoid-Taxes Myth.

hook.text: People say the rich will flee if taxes rise. The data says most of them stay put.

buildup.text: Stanford researcher Cristobal Young tracked millions of top earners across US states.

discovery.text: Only about 2% of millionaires move across state lines in any given year regardless of tax changes.

twist.text: The rich have deep local roots: businesses, clients, social networks, and family. Moving is costly.

climax.text: Some do move, but far fewer than predicted. Tax flight is real but vastly overstated.

quiz.question: What did research find about wealthy people moving to avoid taxes?
